block.p: Charlotte Luxmore Cudlip, the daughter of Mrs. David S. Dickenson II of Gates Mills, Ohio, and Charles T. Cudlip of Washington, was married yesterday to Perry Lewis Bartol, the son of Melanie Smith of Southport, Conn., and Peter W. Bartol of Charlottesville, Va. The Rev. Dr. Luis Leon officiated at St. John's Episcopal Church in Washington. The Rev. Gregory Jones, a cousin of the bridegroom and an Episcopal priest, took part in the ceremony.

Mrs. Bartol, 33, is a manager in New York with the health care division of Kurt Salmon Associates, a management consulting firm. She graduated cum laude from Georgetown University and received a master's degree in management from Northwestern University. Her father is the chairman of the Hannibal Group, a telecommunications and Internet consulting company in Washington.

Charlotte Luxmore Cudlip, the daughter of Mrs. David S. Dickenson II of Gates Mills, Ohio, and Charles T. Cudlip of Washington, was married yesterday to Perry Lewis Bartol, the son of Melanie Smith of Southport, Conn., and Peter W. Bartol of Charlottesville, Va. The Rev. Dr. Luis Leon officiated at St. John's Episcopal Church in Washington. The Rev. Gregory Jones, a cousin of the bridegroom and an Episcopal priest, took part in the ceremony.

Mrs. Bartol, 33, is a manager in New York with the health care division of Kurt Salmon Associates, a management consulting firm. She graduated cum laude from Georgetown University and received a master's degree in management from Northwestern University. Her father is the chairman of the Hannibal Group, a telecommunications and Internet consulting company in Washington.

Mr. Bartol, 34, is a managing director with the industrial-sector investment banking division of J. P. Morgan in New York. He graduated magna cum laude from Colgate University. His mother is a partner in Jensen-Smith Real Estate in Southport. His father is the chief financial officer at ExplorerLearning.com, an educational Internet site in Charlottesville.
